//: A rural holdout survivor trying to stay safe.

dynamic_line.no: Well I'll be, I was thinking it's just another monster skulking about.  And you are?

responses.text: Just a survivor, looking around. Who are you?
What did you before all this?
Is there something I can do for you?

dynamic_line: I worked on a ranch not too far from here before it all went down.  I'd love to get back to what I did - taking care of horses, cows, all sorts of animals, making sure the fields stay safe and all.  But now? I dunno, man.  Just trying to survive, I suppose.  Hopefully, the world will get back together one day and I can put my skills to use doing what I like.
Name's Russell.  I was just sort of wandering around, hoping to maybe find some decent gear.  Decided to rest up, heard someone walking, and, well, here we are.
Can't say I can think of something specific right now.  Gotta say though, maybe it oughta be a good idea for us to travel together - safety in numbers and all that.

responses.text: Is it a good idea to trust a stranger like me this easily?
Sounds like a good idea - want to join me, then?

dynamic_line: Why, that sounds swell.  Been around the old road long enough to know how to handle myself a good bit.  Knew my way around a gun ever since my dad taught me how to shoot when I was a kid, so you don't have to worry about me doing my part.

responses.text: On a second thought, let me think about it a bit more

dynamic_line: Don't have much of a choice, do I?  On my own, a monster will get lucky sooner or later, and even if I kill it, bleeding out in some alley is a prospect I do not fancy.  Plus, we just had a nice, civil chat where no one tried to kill the other, so I reckon we're off to a good start, all things considered.

responses.text: Fair enough.  Want to travel with me, then?
Can't say I really agree.  I'll be going now.
